ai.summary: Blue is a 7.1 km moderate hike in the UK with varied terrain and scenic highlights. Suitable for hikers with a reasonable level of fitness and some trail experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of woodland paths, grassy tracks, and occasional rocky sections. Expect gentle ascents and descents, with uneven surfaces and possible mud, especially after rain. Some exposed sections may have broad, open ground and narrow paths.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go; the UK can be changeable. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Bring a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Stay on marked paths, tell someone your plan, and be prepared for sudden changes in conditions; consider daylight hours when planning the hike.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) generally offer the best conditions; the route can be hiked in winter with appropriate gear and daylight, but expect muddier trails and colder weather.
